text.p: Ferrofluidics Corp said Wednesday it expected revenues for the fiscal year to be "relatively consistent" with those of fiscal 1996 due to a slowdown in the semiconductor industry.
The company said it had postponed from fiscal 1997 to fiscal 1998 about half of its shipments of crystal pullers after consulting with its customers in the semiconductor industry.
It said the impact of the delays would be felt in the first half of fiscal 1997.
But the company said it expected the delays to be partially offset during fiscal 1997 by anticipated increases in shipments to four international silicon wafer manufacturers.
Ferrofluidics makes the equipment that is used to make silicon wafers, the raw material for microprocessing chips.
Earlier it reported revenues for the year ended June 30 of $73.0 million, up sharply from $34.2 million a year before.
